p: Different solvents including n-hexane, aqueous, ethanolic, hydro-alcoholic, methanolic, and others were used in extracts preparation ( Figure 2). Among all, the methanol extract was the predominant one. Bioassays reported in this review included, egg hatching test (EHT), larval development test (LDT), larval motility test (LMT), adult worm motility test (AWMT), adult parasite mortality test (APMT), and larval artificial exsheathment assay (LAEA) in in vitro studies, while fecal egg count reduction (FECR), egg count per gram of feces (EPG), total warm count reduction (TWC/WCR) in in vivo studies. Furthermore, among the above mentioned assays, EHT was the most widely used assay for evaluation of medicinal plants against H. contortus in vitro, while FECR was common in vivo. Sheep were the commonly used experimental model in vivo ( Supplementary Table S3).
